pros: Love being able to work with learners and employers like under the apprenticeship schemes.  Thoroughly enjoy going into a variety of workplaces to deliver a qualifications that differs from place to place.  Its great being master of your own timetable and having the flexibility to really fit in with the learners work patterns.  I enjoy being able to take formal classroom teach sessions but also being able to tailor both formal and informal sessions with the learner.  Being an assessor allows you to create a learning package to suit each individual.  I work for Cornwall College Business which is a small and very supportive team and each day I look forward to going to work!
cons: As a training assessor the majority of my time is spent in the working environment and not in the college so for me there are no cons :)

review_title: Good support from colleagues, management poor
job_title: Training Lead in Saint Austell, England
pros: As above but work life balance often stretched due to hour expectations way above usual weekly requirements for students to fully profess
cons: As above but contact time increasing termly without preparation time needed to ensure a quality student experience causing immense stress and pressure
